data.title: Good food and drink. Live music was good and entertaining
data.text: I attended a large group birthday party at Robbin's Next. Our services was good and enjoyed food, drinks and music.

data.title: A Hidden Gem for food, drinks and atmosphere
data.text: Tried Robbins Nest for the first time this weekend.  Was a bit hidden off of 2nd Street down a little alley but worth the find.  The service was great and the food even better.  It has a very relaxing and arty feel in the interior, some interesting art on the walls.  There was a lot of open seating when we arrived.  We had a couple of appetizers, my fav was the pastrami rolls (like eggs rolls but way better!!)  We also had the charcuterie platter with a delicious selection of cheeses and meats. Then shared some salad and pizza selections, can't pick a favorite loved them all.  The menu changes so don't rely on the website.  I definitely want to come back and do some more wine tasting.

data.title: Happy hour
data.text: Happy hour selection is small but great. Service was Attentive. The charcuterie and cheese plate was amazing!

data.title: Great potato chips
data.text: I usually come here for drinks but I decided to have lunch on this occasion. I had the chicken pesto with a salad and it was great. The sandwich itself was smaller than I thought but it was really good. The cheese they use is of great quality and so are the other ingredients. The staff is really friendly and always willing to help. They also serve beer and change their taps often enough with top choice beers. I'm an IPA guy myself so when I saw space dust IPA I couldn't resist. The wine selection is pretty good but I do wish they had some older vintages. Enjoy.

data.title: Nice Change of Pace in DTSA
data.text:
Robbins Nest is quickly becoming a favorite stop in DTSA, tucked away down it’s little path between buildings. Had the chance to visit for both lunch and dinner and have been super impressed every time I’ve stopped in. The location is amazing and very nicely appointed. The staff is the absolute best—very friendly, helpful, and accommodating—though a bit slow during busier times. But the real star here is the food. 

Do yourself a favor and start with the Charcuterie Board. Had it several times now and the selections have changed with each visit, though the honey and dried fruits seem to be a staple. Nice touch on keeping the variety up. I’ve tried a few items on the menu, but for a mushroom lover like me, the 3 Fun Guys in a Van pizza is the clear winner. Excellent apportionment of sauce to cheese to toppings, and comes in at a pleasant size that leaves me feeling perfectly satiated. 

But when all's said and done and you’re in the mood for dessert, be sure to order the cheesecake. Now, I’ve sampled my share of cheesecakes in my life, but the one at the Robbins Nest is hands down the best. It blows all other cheesecakes out of the water. No contest.

data.title: SoCal trip
data.text:
Stooped by for a glass of Brassfield, Chardonnay.  Paired with their Charcuterie and Cheese platter. Also ordered their bruchetta.  Exceklant. Pleasant, relaxing environment.  
l

data.title: Drinks with friends!
data.text: I see why the wine bar's name contains the word "Nest."  This place is where one goes to relax, kick back, enjoy a glass of wine among friends.  The food is pretty good too.  They had a live jazz band the night we were there and that was fun.  The service is friendly and attentive.  Convenient public parking garage right across the street too.  Would definitely go back!

data.title: Where 50-year old pizza dough recipes go to die.
data.text:
While Robbins Nest Wine Bar & Bistro is a fine establishment conducive to the enjoyment of wine and kibitzing, it is most assuredly not a destination where sustenance is the focus.  Food is a fallacy, if not a farce.  

Guiled by the alleged 50-year old pizza dough recipe, I was misled by disreputable subterfuge.  

Additionally, the smoked pork tacos are liberally saturated with the homemade BBQ sauce and served at room temperature.  Not entirely pleasing, but also not an assault to my sensory organs. 

However, the seasoned crispy fries are infallible and delivered as documented.  

Go for the wine, but do not stay for the food.

data.title: Great Date Night Restaurant!
data.text: We wandered in after the Art Walk in Santa Ana and were pleasantly surprised by how low key and welcoming it was!  They have a great wine list and and menu.  We ordered the Three Fun Guys and a Mini-Van pizza that was crazy good with a Malbec.  We didn't want to leave, so MORE wine and the charcuterie platter just so we could stay and listen to the great live music and chat.  I say this because I hate it when I go out and the music in the lounge is so loud you can't talk!  The owner stopped by and told us about their amazing burgers and pastrami spring rolls which are their best sellers.  We will be back, hungrier next time, to try them both!

data.title: Date Night - great Bite
data.text: Our first visit to The Robbin's Nest was an absolute delight.  We were greeted by Violet who explained the restaurant's interesting history  and menu favorites.  Be sure to try the spring rolls!!  The Nest Burger paired wonderfully with the Sky Fall Cabernet.  What a tasty local jewel.  The owner, Lisa Robbins couldn't be more welcoming.    We're coming back soon!

data.title: Great wine selection
data.text:
We stopped here for a bite to eat when friends of ours were eating elsewhere. The ambience was great, and there was a live band playing (I think because it was a Saturday night). It was quite loud (not the sort of place for intimate conversation) but had a great vibe. Our server was lovely and couldn't have been more helpful, and there was an extensive wine list, which the staff were more than happy to help you with. 

I have allergies to yeast and dairy, so there were really limited options on the menu. I had the bone in chicken with quinoa - it was Ok but the garlic was hugely overpowering. My partner had a pizza which was small but clearly made with good quality ingredients. The fries to start with were good with amazing home made salsa and aioli. 

Definitely somewhere for small bar snacks and great wine rather than a meal out, but couldn't fault the service or environment. Hope to return again!

data.title: Great place to stop for a glass of wine
data.text:
This is a very pretty setting with a good list of wines (many available by the glass).  I wish they would take their wine education role a bit more seriously with short descriptions of the wines, for example.  Our server seemed well informed, so information was available, but more information would be a good addition.

Robbins Nest is definitely worth a visit.

data.title: Quaint wine bar
data.text:
I chilled at Robbins Nest while waiting for friends to show up at Savor Santa Ana (which in hindsight I wish I had just stayed here and forgot about Savor SA).

What a great addition to this area! Just the little boost it needed to go along with all my favorite restaurants in OC! I love the interior and set-up. There are bar stools, tables, and couches in different locations around the restaurant. 

We didn't stay long but I did order a glass of wine and had the seasoned crispy fries. I loved the spicy ketchup served on the side along with a garlic aioli (also good). 

The bartender was very helpful in helping others around me select wine. I was happy to see wines from CA wineries that I've visited and liked but usually never find on menus around here. 

I can't wait to go back and try more food.

data.title: New Bistro in the Artists' Village
data.text: We loved this new addition to the Artists' Village in Santa Ana.  The décor is wonderful, the food is delicious, the wine list is extensive and the owners are delightful!  This will be one of my "go to" places for lunch.
